section.name: Download
section.p: Download the latest release version of the JETT library from SourceForge.net.

section.name: Installation
section.p: To use the JETT library, place the jett-core jar in your classpath.
The following libraries are also required to exist on your classpath:
The JETT library does rely on JUnit 4.8.2, but only for JUnit test cases when building through Maven.

section.name: Building from source
section.p: It is possible to build JETT directly from its source code, if the latest unreleased changes are needed. Use a Subversion client to get the source code and Apache Maven to build it. Here are the steps:

ol.li: Get the latest JETT source code from Sourceforge Subversion using the following command: svn co https://jett.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/jett/trunk jett
Run the following Maven command to build JETT and install it into the local repository: mvn clean install
